text: Luxembourg was represented by Belgian singer Sarah Bray, with the song '"Un baiser volé", at the 1991 Eurovision Song Contest, which took place on 4 May in Rome. The song was chosen internally by broadcaster RTL. == At Eurovision == On the night of the final Bray performed 7th in the running order, following Austria and preceding eventual contest winners Sweden. "Un baiser volé" had been predicted as a likely mid-table finisher, and at the close of voting had received 29 points, placing Luxembourg 14th of the 22 entries. The Luxembourgian jury awarded its 12 points to Switzerland.ESC History - Luxembourg 1991 ==Voting== ===Points awarded by Luxembourg=== ====Final==== {| class="wikitable" |- |width=20% bgcolor="gold"|12 points|| |- |width=20% bgcolor="silver"|10 points|| |- |width=20% bgcolor="#CC9966"|8 points|| |- |width=20%|7 points|| |- |width=20%|6 points|| |- |width=20%|5 points|| |- |width=20%|4 points|| |- |width=20%|3 points|| |- |width=20%|2 points|| |- |width=20%|1 point|| |- |} ===Points awarded to Luxembourg=== {| class="wikitable" |+Points awarded to Luxembourg (final) |- !width=20%|12 points !width=20%|10 points !width=20%|8 points !width=20%|7 points !width=20%|6 points |- | valign="top" | | valign="top" | | valign="top" | | valign="top" | | valign="top" | |- !width=20%|5 points !width=20%|4 points !width=20%|3 points !width=20%|2 points !width=20%|1 point |- | valign="top" | * | valign="top" | * * | valign="top" | * * * | valign="top" | * * * | valign="top" | * |} ==See also== *Luxembourg in the Eurovision Song Contest *Eurovision Song Contest 1991 == References == Category:Countries in the Eurovision Song Contest 1991 Category:Luxembourg in the Eurovision Song Contest Category:1991 in Luxembourg
